org.axiondb.util
Class ObjectBTree

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--org.axiondb.util.ObjectBTree
public class ObjectBTree
extends Object

A B-Tree for Objects, based on the implementation described in "Introduction to Algorithms" by Cormen, Leiserson and Rivest (CLR). (Based on BTree, written by Chuck Burdick and Dave Pekarek Krohn.)

Version:
$Revision: 1.14 $ $Date: 2003/07/11 17:04:06 $

allocate

loadIdxCtr

public void loadIdxCtr()
                throws IOException
Loads the counter file if it exists. This sets the counter. Only the root should ever call this.

IOException

saveIdxCtr

public void saveIdxCtr()
                throws IOException
Saves out the counter file. This should only ever be called by the root.

getLeftMost

public void getLeftMost(Object[] keyParam,
                        int[] valueParam)
                 throws IOException,
                        ClassNotFoundException
Finds and deletes the left most value from this subtree. The key and value for the node is returned in the parameters. This also does the replacement as it unwraps.

IOException
ClassNotFoundException

getRightMost

public void getRightMost(Object[] keyParam,
                         int[] valueParam)
                  throws IOException,
                         ClassNotFoundException
Finds and deletes the right most value from this subtree. The key and value for the node is returned in the parameters. This also does the replacement as it unwraps.

IOException

get

public Integer get(Object key)
            throws IOException,
                   ClassNotFoundException
Uses the shortest path to a matching entry and returns its value. Not necessarily the least value, the first entered, or the leftmost.

IOException
ClassNotFoundException

subdivideChild

public void subdivideChild(int pivot,
                           ObjectBTree child)
                    throws IOException,
                           ClassNotFoundException
IOException
ClassNotFoundException

write

public void write()
           throws IOException
Writes the node file out. This is differentiated from save in that it doesn't save the entire tree or the counter file.

IOException

save

public void save(File dataDirectory)
          throws IOException,
                 ClassNotFoundException
Saves the tree. It saves the counter file, writes out the node and then calls save recursively through the tree.

IOException
ClassNotFoundException

save

public void save()
          throws IOException,
                 ClassNotFoundException
IOException
ClassNotFoundException

read

public void read()
          throws IOException,
                 ClassNotFoundException
Reads in the node. This doesn't read in the entire subtree, which happens incrementally as files are needed.

IOException
ClassNotFoundException
